comments:
The following exception occurs very frequently, causing a slowdown of Eclipse (from the log file):

!ENTRY org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui 4 4 2006-07-12 14:29:08.531
!MESSAGE problem with reconciling
!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 10
        at java.util.ArrayList.clear(Unknown Source)
        at org.eclipse.wst.validation.internal.ValidationRegistryReader.getTempList(ValidationRegistryReader.java:1424)

how are you able to reproduce it?

(In reply to comment #1)
> how are you able to reproduce it?

I'm not sure how to respond. I have a few xml files and a tld file open in the workspace. I didn't really notice what changes I made or files I opened to cause the problem. The following day (today as I'm writing this) the stack traces were not showing up, but the execesive workspace building is still continuing. I'm not sure what files I edited. The only thing I can say for sure is that they were all valid files since I was able to run project through Tomcat. Sorry if that doesn't help much.
Can you attach the project which is  exhibiting this  exception?
Please provide steps, project or  workspace in which the  problem can be reproduced, i am returning this as WORKSFORME since i can't reproduce with my test cases.

We have a tester with apparently a "magic" system that hits this exception frequently.  Though I haven't see this one occur, I did investigate using a WTP 151 development environment.  I put a break point in the getTempList() method and found the breakpoint hit by four separate thread.  I'll attach a copy of the thread display.  Since getTempList() isn't thread safe, it is conceivable that anybody could randomly hit this.

Examining the code, I don't see much of an advantage of recycling the _tempList ArrayList.  After updating the tester's system with a patched version of the org.eclipse.wst.validation plug-in that implements getTempList() with just "return new ArrayList();" the exception has not occurred at all today when it would normally occur about once or twice an hour.

Please re-open and consider changing for 1.5.1.

Created an attachment (id=46978)
Thread display showing 4 thread breaking at getTempList()

This thread display was from a development environment with 1.5.1 source from 7/27/2006.
